    • Constructor Detail

      • HillCypher

        public HillCypher​()
        Default constructor for the Hill Cypher object

      • HillCypher

        public HillCypher​(java.lang.String k)
        This is the constructor method for a hill cypher. It takes in a string, and uses the first four letters as the 2x2 matrix key. If the word is less than 4 letters, it will add letters to fill up the matrix.
        Parameters:
        k - The word you want to be the key for the cypher

    • Method Detail

      • EncryptWord

        public java.lang.String EncryptWord​(java.lang.String word)
        This method takes in a word as a string, and returns an encrypted word using the hill cypher's key.
        Parameters:
        word - The word to encrypt, only takes in characters from the alphabet.
        Returns:
        Returns an encrypted message.

      • DecryptWord

        public java.lang.String DecryptWord​(java.lang.String word)
        This method takes an encrypted word, and deciphers it using the hill cypher's key.
        Parameters:
        word - The word you wish to decrypt, only takes in characters from the alphabet.
        Returns:
        Returns the decrypted message.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is a driver method, showing the utility of the Hill Cypher's encrypt and decrypt methods.
